body_html: Yes, our current code requires that the file object supports the fileno method, so we can recover the file descriptor and write directly to it. This would need to be improved. A workaround for now would be to save the file on disk, compress it and remove the original version (I assume that if it fits in your memory, then it will fit on HDD too).
body_text: Yes, our current code requires that the file object supports the fileno method, so we can recover the file descriptor and write directly to it. This would need to be improved. A workaround for now would be to save the file on disk, compress it and remove the original version (I assume that if it fits in your memory, then it will fit on HDD too).
body: Yes, our current code requires that the file object supports the `fileno` method, so we can recover the file descriptor and write directly to it. This would need to be improved. A workaround for now would be to save the file on disk, compress it and remove the original version (I assume that if it fits in your memory, then it will fit on HDD too).
